summary: AppendRelativePath on unix needs to accept valid '../' pathnames
description:
When using the "Save File" dialog, if I use ".." anywhere in the path (i.e.,
../filename or subdir/../filename), it will not save the file - I can cancel and
close the dialog OK, but clicking the Save button does nothing.

This happens in all Save File dialogs I see.

I don't see this behavior on Windows.
